thread.section_title: Dog owners are more sexually attractive than people who own cats – Metro
thread.title: Dog owners are more sexually attractive than people who own cats
thread.title_full: Dog owners are more sexually attractive than people who own cats

author: Nicole Morley
title: Dog owners are more sexually attractive than people who own cats
text:
Dog lovers are officially hotter than people with cats (Picture: Getty) The competition was tough, but the numbers are finally in. 
It’s official*, dog owners are far more attractive than people who own cats.
Man lets girlfriend have sex with other men but he must stay faithful *Well, according to this study of 1,000 singletons.
The research found that 63% of people find dog owners most attractive, in comparison to 18% of totally wrong people who fancy cat owners.
While 19% of joyless monsters didn’t find pet owners attractive in the slightest.
The study, commissioned by Elite Singles, also discovered that people took pets into consideration while looking for a prospective partner.
BBC just announced Father Christmas isn’t real during a live broadcast An enormous 72% of those questioned say they can predict how a person will act in a relationship on the basis of how they treat their pets.
While 32% of dog owners would dump their date if they were convinced their canine companion wasn’t a fan – and 27% of cat lovers would do the same.
Pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket, raw coke & much more' 
Bully only stopped attack when someone said 'leave her, I think she's dead' 
Seagull caught stealing people's parking tickets 
Salama Marine, a psychologist who specialises in dating, said the figures were reflective of singletons believing selfish people would struggle to raise and keep a pet properly.
She said: ‘As raising animals – particularly active animals like dogs – requires a lot of commitment and dedication, singles with pets are often perceived to be kind, friendly and ready to commit to a long term relationship.’
